item.title: Video games need 'realism boost'
item.description: Characters and worlds created for video games must be made more believable, says an industry expert.

item.title: Digital art aids health checkups
item.description: Doctors turn to graphic artists to help patients better understand their illness and treatment.

item.title: Microsoft $1.5bn MP3 fine dropped
item.description: A US court overturns a decision ordering Microsoft to pay Alcatel-Lucent $1.52bn for patent infringements.

item.title: Lenovo to offer Linux on laptops
item.description: Lenovo, one of the world's biggest PC makers, is to start selling laptops with Linux pre-installed.

item.title: Tomorrow's World 'not returning'
item.description: The BBC dismisses speculation that it is considering reviving its weekly science series Tomorrow's World.

item.title: Fake Jobs blogger unmasked
item.description: The writer of a prominent blog which lampoons Apple boss Steve Jobs is unmasked by the New York Times.

item.title: Warcraft expansion pack unveiled
item.description: The second expansion to the popular World of Warcraft online role-playing game is announced.

item.title: Low-cost PC aims at rural China
item.description: PC-maker Lenovo announces a low-cost computer aimed at the world's most populous country.

item.title: Democrats spar at blog gathering
item.description: Democrat presidential candidates field questions from more than 1,000 bloggers at their annual convention.

item.title: The new wave in Silicon Valley
item.description: Click investigates the start-ups operating in Silicon Valley, as optimism and money pours back into the area.

item.title: Google sidesteps mobile reports
item.description: Google refuses to deny mounting speculation that it is working to produce its own brand mobile phone.

item.title: Warning of webmail wi-fi hijack
item.description: Webmail and social network users are warned about loopholes that let attackers hijack accounts via wi-fi.

item.title: Lift off for Nasa's Mars probe
item.description: Nasa launches a spacecraft on a nine-month trip to Mars, where it will search for signs of past or present life.

item.title: Grand Theft Auto delay hits firm
item.description: Shares in Take-Two fall 16% after it said that its latest version of Grand Theft Auto would be delayed.

item.title: Firms withdraw BNP Facebook ads
item.description: Six firms withdraw adverts from the networking website Facebook after they appear near BNP content.

item.title: Apple iPhone issue highlights security debate
item.description: Regular columnist Bill Thompson says what counts as private has to change if we're to get the most out the network.
